Column Comment.0: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.1: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.2: CREATOR ID: Unique identifier for the creator of this object. This is not a FK from theBusiness associate table, as not all implementations will wish to validate all authorsagainst that module. For validation to BA, use CREATOR_BA_ID. For unvalidatednames, use NAME fields.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CREATOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: Validated business associate who is thecreator of this object.
Column Comment.5: CREATOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE TYPE: The type of business associate who isthe creator, such as PERSON, COMPANY or GOVERNMENT.
Column Comment.6: CREATOR NAME: the full name of a company or person as it appears ondocumentation, to be used in the case where the user does not wish to include thecontact in the list of valid business associates (BUSINESS ASSOCIATE). Pleasenote that use of this field will make searches more difficult and may result indegraded data quality.
Column Comment.7: REFERENCE CREATOR TYPE: The type of creatorship of a document, report orother object. Could be primary author, corporate author, scientific author, laboratory,field collection etc
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: FIRST NAME: first name or initial of the contact, used only when the name is notvalidated against the Business Associate tables.
Column Comment.11: LAST NAME: last name of the contact, used only when the name is not validatedagainst the Business Associate tables.
Column Comment.12: MIDDLE NAME: Middle name or initials of the contact, used only when the name isnot validated against the Business Associate tables.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
